channel.title: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?
channel.description:
[This is actually to rsps but I don't think I will get an answer in that thread about this..]
As the title says!
I am trying to make a custom expanded command. That needs several classes. I am just messing around in my class and hope for the best that it will work.. If you want to see the class.. I have to kill you first.. because it is a real mess..
Add me on skype.. name: addemod
EDIT: I can explain better.
When I do a command, etc. ::position I want it to write out the playername and the position the player is on. Then if the player does the command again, I want just HIS line to be removed then make a new line with his information. That means, I want to update his position in the file. Without making a new row or affecting the other rows..?
Understand?

item.title: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

You can do this easily by using a database. MySQL is probably the most notorious, although it would require learning basic SQL. By using a database, you are capable of efficiently storing large amounts of data at a quick rate. This solution sounds like it’s a little bit to ‘advanced’ for you at this time. Maybe you will find it useful in the future.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?

item.title: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

read a line
split it up into String[]
check if the first value equals the player’s name.
change the line(s) accordingly.

This seems inefficient though, why would you want to keep track of player commands? :o
You could also just make a raw list and then orden it later on o.o

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?

item.title: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?
item.dc:creator: @Supah_Flyizzle Supah Flyizzle
item.description:
@Supah_Flyizzle wrote:

i guess you mean that you want to have all the rows be unique to each player that does the command?

you can accomplish that by searching (or indexing, but that’s a bit advance) through the file and if you can find a player’s username, seek to the beginning of the line and write over that data or if you can’t find an entry then append.

randomaccessstream etc.

i don’t really understand your question because it’s not worded very clearly but wouldn’t a database be better suited for this? it literally does everything you’re asking and about a billion things more.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?

item.title: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

assuming what you want to read isn’t in the gigabytes, just load it into ram.

Read full topic
item.source: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?

item.title: How can I use BufferedReader/Writer to remove one line then write something new?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

You really do not want to do that its going to be really slow and grind your HDD

load the file at the start of the program and store all the data in a object

then modify the object as necessary. when you shut down the program write the object to file

Read full topic
